review: Price is right and it is easy to hookup, but statement: "Fire TV Stick connects to your TV's HDMI port. It's an easy way to enjoy over 250,000 TV episodes and movies on Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, HBO GO, and Hulu Plus, plus games, music, and more" - is not finished. Should sadd: "if you pay 3 to 10 times more than renting at other rental outlets (like Safeway). There is no single movie you can watch for free, always have to either register for monthly payment to Netflix, HBO, Hulu etc.or pay for individual movies. I'm totally disappointed.

review: I use this in my RV.  It works great wherever we have a wireless internet connection.  Happy I gave it a shot during Amazon's July black-Friday thing (even if most of the deals were lame...this deal worked out!)  If you don't have a smart TV with integrated Netflix or Amazon Prime or a host of other aps....this will work for you.  I haven't seen the Google or Apple products...so can't compare.  But for $25, I'm a happy camper.  *Get it?  I use it in my RV...happy camper.  Get it?Not five stars because the MLB ap doesn't work very good...if Amazon can get MLB to fix that ap, I'd be an ecstatic camper.

review: This was a great get!!!  Very easy to set up, very easy to control.  I like the parental controls a great deal - very easy to understand and adjust!  The major streaming options (netflix, hulu, etc) are  included with the device, and the connection to WiFi is very reliable and stable.  The MirraCast worked perfectly, which makes in-home classes easier, because my laptop identifies it as a second monitor... so does my phone, which makes showing presentations using it easier also.  My phone's aspect ratio translates to the monitor, so it knows if my phone is in landscape or portrait mode, and adjusts correctly.This has been a great addition to our media set-up.  The thing that I'd add to it?  It doesn't connect to bluetooth speakers, which I think is sort of an oversight on Amazon's part.I'd recommend one of these to anyone... we REALLY have enjoyed it!!!
author: Jim Besso
